stacks.description: Q1. What discussions he has had with the Secretary of State for Energy Security and Net Zero on the potential for new nuclear power sites in Scotland. (906510)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Mr Peter Bedford MP (Mid Leicestershire, Conservative)

stacks.description: Q2. What discussions he has had with the Chancellor of the Exchequer on the potential impact of her policies on the cost of living in Scotland. (906511)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Rt Hon Liz Saville Roberts MP (Dwyfor Meirionnydd, Plaid Cymru)

stacks.description: Q3. What assessment he has made with Cabinet colleagues of recent trends in levels of economic growth in Scotland. (906512)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Jerome Mayhew MP (Broadland and Fakenham, Conservative)

stacks.description: Q4. What discussions he has had with the Secretary of State for the Home Department on the potential impact of the UK's asylum and returns policies on Scotland. (906513)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Pete Wishart MP (Perth and Kinross-shire, Scottish National Party)

stacks.description: Q5. What discussions he has had with the Scottish Government on skills, development and training for the Forth Valley area. (906514)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Chris Kane MP (Stirling and Strathallan, Labour)

stacks.description: Q6. What steps he is taking with Cabinet colleagues to support skills and training in the defence sector in Scotland. (906515)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Richard Baker MP (Glenrothes and Mid Fife, Labour)

stacks.description: Q7. What steps he is taking with Cabinet colleagues to support regeneration in Scotland through the Pride in Place programme. (906516)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Elaine Stewart MP (Ayr, Carrick and Cumnock, Labour)

stacks.description: Q8. What assessment he has made of the potential impact of changes to Agricultural Property Relief and Business Property Relief on Scottish family farms. (906517)
Q9. What assessment he has made of the impact of the Windsor Framework on trade between Scotland and Northern Ireland. (906518)
Q10. What discussions he has had with the Chancellor of the Exchequer on the potential impact of her policies on the cost of living in Scotland. (906519)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Kirsty Blackman MP (Aberdeen North, Scottish National Party)

stacks.description: Q11. What steps he is taking with Cabinet colleagues to help ensure that UK public bodies in Scotland implement the For Women Scotland Ltd v The Scottish Ministers Supreme Court judgment. (906520)
Q12. What discussions he has had with the Chancellor of the Exchequer on the potential impact of her policies on the cost of living in Scotland. (906521)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Seamus Logan MP (Aberdeenshire North and Moray East, Scottish National Party)

stacks.description: Q13. What discussions he has had with the Scottish Government on support for transport services for Scottish islands. (906522)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Andrew George MP (St Ives, Liberal Democrat)

stacks.description: Q14. What discussions he has had with the Secretary of State for Energy Security and Net Zero on the potential for new nuclear power sites in Scotland. (906523)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Sir Geoffrey Clifton-Brown MP (North Cotswolds, Conservative)

stacks.description: Q15. What discussions he has had with the Secretary of State for Energy Security and Net Zero on the potential for new nuclear power sites in Scotland. (906524)
stacks.iasDisplayAs: Alison Griffiths MP (Bognor Regis and Littlehampton, Conservative)

stacks.description: Financial Statement: Financial Statement and Budget Report At the end of the Chancellor’s Statement, the first Budget Resolution will be moved and debate on the Budget Resolutions will take place
